alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 1:16PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Placer, El Dorado, Nevada, southern Washoe, and Douglas Counties and west central Carson City through 145 PM PDT... At 116 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Northstar, or near Prosser Creek Reservoir, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carson City, Kings Beach, Prosser Creek Reservoir, Tahoe City, Boca Reservoir, Incline Village, Glenshire-Devonshire Cdp, Northstar, Crystal Bay, Incline Village-Crystal Bay, Hirschdale, Carnelian Bay, Truckee, Granite Flat Campground, Lakeside Campground, Glenshire-Devonshire, Alpine Meadows Campground, Boca Campground, Truckee-Tahoe Airport and Silver Creek Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near north Lake Tahoe, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
